page.title: 11A small fen farm 2
page.content: Mr. Green is a local farmer, he has about 20 fields and grows mostly crops but in the winter he keeps beefeaters. Beefeaters are store cattle. His favourite crop is sugar-beet mainly because he makes more money out of it. He sells potatoes to local merchants who in turn sell them to wholesalers, who pack them and take them to local stores. He sells his corn crop to the local farmers co-operative. They buy corn from many farmers and sell them in big quantities to firms like Hovis and MacDougals. His sugarbeet crop is grown and sold under contract to the British Sugar Corporation. These are refined in their factory in Peterborough. He is only allowed to grow a certain amount each year and is paid a guaranteed price.
